description: Modification of earlier restiff, from Middle English restyf, from Old French restif, from rester (“stay, remain”), from Latin restō.

adjectives.description: restive (comparative more restive, superlative most restive)

entries.meaning: Impatient under delay, duress, or control.
examples: Synonyms: anxious, champing at the bit, fidgety, restless, uneasy
Synonyms: disobedient, rebellious, recalcitrant, refractory, uncooperative, unruly

entries.meaning: Refusing to move, especially in a forward direction.
